sentences.sentence: The sexton’s wife waited a long time for her husband, but he did not come back.
So she woke the boy up and asked him, “Do you know where my husband is? He climbed up the tower before you did.”
“No, I don’t know,” replied the boy, “but someone was standing at the top of the tower, and as he would neither give an answer nor go away,
I thought he was a criminal( 罪犯 ) and pushed him down the stairs( 楼梯 ). I really hope it wasn’t your husband.”
The woman ran up the tower and found her husband, who had hurt his leg and could not move.
She carried him down, and then went to the boy’s father.
“Look what your son has done!” she said.
“He has pushed my husband down the stairs, and he has hurt his leg. Take this useless son of yours away from our house.”
The father was terribly( 非常 ) angry, and scolded( 责骂 ) the boy.
“What wicked( 坏的 ) tricks( 恶作剧 ) are these?” said he.
“The devil( 魔鬼 ) must have put this into your head.”
“Father,” he replied, “I am quite innocent( 无辜的 ).
He was standing there by night like a criminal.
I did not know who it was, and I asked him three times either to speak or go away.”
“Ah,” said the father, “you are nothing but trouble. Go away—I never want to see you again!”
“Yes, father. As soon as the sun rises, I will leave this village and learn how to be scared( 被惊吓 ).
Then I shall have a skill that I can use to earn( 挣得 ) my living.”
“Do whatever you want,” said the father.
“I don’t care. Here are fifty thalers( 泰勒（德国的旧银币名） ) for you. Take these and go into the wide world.
Tell no one where you come from, and whatever you do, tell no one who your father is, because I am ashamed( 羞耻的 ) of you.”
“Yes, father, if that is all you want of me, I promise to do it.” the son replied.
When day dawned( 破晓 ), therefore, he put his fifty thalers into his pocket, and walked until he came to the main road.
And as he walked, he was saying to himself, “If only I could find something that scared( （使）害怕 ) me!”
A man heard what the boy was saying to himself, and when they had walked a little farther to where they could see the gallows( 绞刑架 ), the man said to him,
“Look, there is the tree where seven men have tested some ropes with their necks, and are now learning how to fly.
Sit down below it, and wait till night comes, and you will soon learn what it is to be scared( 被惊吓 ).”
“If that is all it takes,” he replied, “it is easily done.
If I really learn how to be scared, you shall have my fifty thalers. Just come back to me early in the morning.”
Then he went to the gallows, sat down below it, and waited till evening came.
And as he was cold, he lit a fire, but at midnight the wind blew so hard that even with his fire, he could not get warm.
And as the wind knocked the hanged men against each other, and they moved this way and that, he thought to himself,
“I am cold even though I have a fire—how cold those men up there must be!”
And because he felt pity for them, he raised the ladder( 梯子 ), and climbed up, untied them one after another, and brought down all seven.
Then he put more wood on the fire and set them all round to warm themselves.
But they sat there and did not move, and their clothes caught on fire( 着火 ).
So he said, “Take care, or I will hang you up again.”
The dead men, however, did not hear, but were quite silent, and let their clothes go on burning.
Then he grew angry, and said,
“If you will not take care of yourselves, I cannot help you,” and he hung them up again each in his turn.
Then he sat down by his fire and fell asleep.
The next morning the man came to him and wanted to have the fifty thalers.
He said, “Well, were you scared?”
“No,” answered he, “what was supposed to scare me? Those men up there did not open their mouths, and were so stupid that they let their clothes get burnt.”
Then the man understood that he would not get the fifty thalers, and went away saying, “What a strange young person!”

question.cn: 当父亲得知小儿子把教堂司事推下时，做了什么？
question.en: How did the father react when he found out that his younger son pushed the sexton off the tower?

options.cn: 他感到骄傲并表扬了小儿子。
options.en: He was proud and praised his son.

options.cn: 他感到生气并把小儿子关在马厩。
options.en: He was angry and shut his son in the stable.

options.cn: 他感到生气并赶走了小儿子。
options.en: He was angry and drove his son away.

analysis: 文中提到：“The father was terribly angry, and scolded the boy. “Ah,” said the father, "you are nothing but trouble. Go away—I never want to see you again!”，因此答案选C。

question.cn: 如果男孩被吓到，他会给男人什么？
question.en: What would the boy give the man if he really learned how to be scared?

options.en: He would give the man fifty thalers.

options.cn: 他会把他的食物给男人。
options.en: He would give the man his food.

options.cn: 他不会给男人任何东西。
options.en: He would give the man nothing.

analysis: 文中提到：“If I really learn how to be scared, you shall have my fifty thalers.”因此答案选A。

question.cn: 当男人得知男孩没被吓到时，是何反应？
question.en: What was the man’s response when he knew that the boy had not been scared?

options.en: He thought the boy was mad.
He thought the boy was strange.
He thought the boy was brave.

analysis: 文中提到：Then the man understood that he would not get the fifty thalers, and went away saying, “What a strange young person!”因此答案选B。
